title: Facebook#039;s New #039;Dislike#039; Button
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
18 Sep 2015 01:54 AM EST 
This week, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that something resembling a Facebook Dislike button is on its way. At Facebook headquarters in Menlo Park, Zuckerberg said during a Q&A “People have asked about the dislike button for many years. Today is a special day because today is the day I can say we’re working on it and shipping it.” Facebook isn’t adding the feature just because we’ve been begging for it pretty much since the inception of the Like button in 2009. It’s another way to feed data into the algorithms that Facebook uses to serve you ads and content, the stuff that makes the company $$$.
